description:
The New York late-stage startup banks $70 million in a new funding round led by Evolution Equity Partners.

The post Torq Secures $70M Series C for HyperSOC appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Torq Secures $70M Series C for HyperSOC

description:
Microsoft reboots controversial Windows Recall with proof-of-presence encryption, anti-tampering checks, and secure enclave data management.

The post Controversial Windows Recall AI Search Tool Returns With Proof-of-Presence Encryption, Data Isolation appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Controversial Windows Recall AI Search Tool Returns With Proof-of-Presence Encryption, Data Isolation

description:
Five Eyes cybersecurity agencies have released joint guidance on identifying Active Directory compromises.

The post Five Eyes Agencies Release Guidance on Detecting Active Directory Intrusions appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Five Eyes Agencies Release Guidance on Detecting Active Directory Intrusions

description:
Incubated at Cambridge University’s engineering department, Featurespace's algorithmic-based solutions analyze transaction data to detect fraud cases.

The post Visa to Acquire Fraud Protection Firm Featurespace appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Visa to Acquire Fraud Protection Firm Featurespace

description:
Meta fined more than $100 million by a European Union privacy regulator over a security lapse involving Facebook passwords.

The post Meta Hit With $102 Million Privacy Fine From European Union Over 2019 Password Security Lapse appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Meta Hit With $102 Million Privacy Fine From European Union Over 2019 Password Security Lapse

description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: China’s Salt Typhoon has hacked US ISPs, China has doxed Taiwanese hackers, and Bishop Fox has a new tool for AI attacks.

The post In Other News: Salt Typhoon Hacks US ISPs, China Doxes Hackers, New Tool for AI Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: In Other News: Salt Typhoon Hacks US ISPs, China Doxes Hackers, New Tool for AI Attacks

description:
US offers up to $10 million for information on Timur Shakhmametov, charging him with running the carding website Joker’s Stash.

The post US Announces Charges, Sanctions Against Russian Administrator of Carding Website appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Announces Charges, Sanctions Against Russian Administrator of Carding Website

description:
Experts believe schemes like this will become more common now that the technical barriers that once existed around generative artificial intelligence have decreased.

The post Sophistication of AI-Backed Operation Targeting Senator Points to Future of Deepfake Schemes appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Sophistication of AI-Backed Operation Targeting Senator Points to Future of Deepfake Schemes

description:
The Tor Project announced that it has merged operations with the security-focused operating system Tails. 

The post Tor Merges With Security-Focused OS Tails appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Tor Merges With Security-Focused OS Tails

description:
Security researchers detail vulnerabilities in Kia owners’ portal that allowed them to control vehicles remotely.

The post Millions of Kia Cars Were Vulnerable to Remote Hacking: Researchers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Millions of Kia Cars Were Vulnerable to Remote Hacking: Researchers

description:
Users continue to flame Kaspersky and Pango Group as the automatic, forced transition to UltraAV gradually progresses.

The post Kaspersky, Pango Respond to User Backlash as Transition to UltraAV Nearly Complete appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Kaspersky, Pango Respond to User Backlash as Transition to UltraAV Nearly Complete

description:
A researcher has disclosed the details of an unpatched vulnerability that was expected to pose a serious threat to many Linux systems.

The post Highly Anticipated Linux Flaw Allows Remote Code Execution, but Less Serious Than Expected appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Highly Anticipated Linux Flaw Allows Remote Code Execution, but Less Serious Than Expected
